root: ^Here she is, the first client of the day.

^Bernadette is a beautiful woman. Months ago, on the day of your first meeting, your manager looked her up and down – you still remember that look – and said, "Usually it's me paying girls like her, not the other way round, you know what I mean?"
^Bernadette must be used to unwanted attention, you think.

skip_a: ^Every time she comes back for a treatment, she reclines on the massage bed, places her manicured hands on the armrests. There's weariness in her gaze, every time.
^"So nice to see you again, miracle worker," she says, and her voice is perfectly melodic, but you feel an edge to it. Tension.

s: ^They've taught you well in your courses.

c-0: ^As an accredited MASK aesthetician, you should notice the smallest signs of uneasiness and manage your clients' distress according to the company policy.

her_day: ^"Busy, but good. I went around ten stores looking for a birthday present for Jake – that's my partner, I've mentioned him, right? – you see, he picked up this hobby…"
^She tells you about her partner's growing collection, and her excitement is so palpable, so earnest – a love like theirs must be a blessing.

^Her pose paints a different picture. Maybe she didn't exaggerate the number of shops she had to visit, or maybe it's something else entirely. What matters is that there's an obstacle between Bernadette and blissful happiness.

c-0: ^You weren't clever enough to become a teacher, and you weren't brave enough to fight fires for a living, so you became an aesthetician.

training: ^It took five years for MASK to shape you into something useful, and now you know how to mix the right ingredients, and how to hold your hands just right while applying the mixture to a face, and how to remove the stiffened mask from it with all the dirt and pain and garbage memories. You do all this; then you discard the mask. You're good at your job.
application: ^You paint Bernadette's face with it, line after line, and wait for her to drift into sleep. The treatment helps your clients relax: some fall into a trance-like state, others lie still and unthinking; Bernie belongs to the second group. Belonged. Her lips twitch.

s: ^You retrace your steps from the moment you've turned on the heater to the last shape you drew, and no, she should be sleeping, she should be calm –

skip_2: ^"Shit. I'm still here, am I not? I shouldn't be."
^The blunt disappointment in her eyes burns you. She continues.

s: ^"Bernadette, please don't be. If anyone should be sorry, it's me."

sorry: ^"There's something wrong with me." Her voice is quieter than usual. Must be the mask working its magic. "You're a professional, I know... I'm sure this doesn't happen to other clients. I must be the problem."

^It never happened to other clients, not on your watch, but why should that matter? You try to calm her down. It takes time, you bring her a warm towel and another one and finally, her breathing evens out.
^"I'm always like this with Jake. Something's wrong with me. I feel too much... It hurts people, that I do. I'm such a…"
done: ^The mask takes longer to peel off this time. A piece gets stuck to the side of her face and if you look at it from a certain angle, it resembles a hand. You've always had an overactive imagination.
^Bernie lies there in silence while you finish the treatment. The moment you're done, you're greeted with her smile.
^"Thank you, seriously, thank you so much!"
^You did it again! This Bernadette is doing so much better, and her voice is softer, and her hair looks like a halo, and her doubts and memories are where they belong, in the garbage bin.

s: ^"Nothing but the best for my most loyal client. Would you like to book the next appointment?"

jake_pays: ^"Oh, no need, and thanks again. You're all so nice to me, you and Jake, and he prefers booking the appointments himself, that's how nice he is! You're even nicer, though. Cos of your job."
^Booking for a partner, hmm. You search Bernie's face for a trace of feeling – is she comfortable with this? Is this what she wants? You see bliss and emptiness, and nothing else.

s: ^"I have to mention, considering the treatment is so personal and comprehensive–"
^"I'll be waiting for his call, then."
^"You're such a lovely couple! It warms my heart, seeing people who care about each other this much."

c-0: ^"–I'm certain your partner wants what's best for you, but please make sure the times he picks work perfectly. Your well-being is MASK's priority."
